items.a: Folio is a digital wallet app that keeps your passports, IDs, tickets, bookings and cards organized in one secure place. It works on iPhone and Android.

items.q: What types of documents can I store?
items.a: Passports, ID cards, residence permits, driver's licenses, travel tickets (flights, trains, hotels, events), payment cards, gift cards, loyalty cards and any other personal document.
You can scan with your camera, upload photos from your library, import PDFs, or forward booking emails to docs@folio.id. Folio automatically extracts key details.

items.q: How does Folio protect my documents?
items.a: Folio uses end-to-end encryption with AES-256. Your documents are encrypted on your device with keys only you control. Even Folio cannot access your data. Biometric protection (Face ID, fingerprint) adds an extra layer of security.
Yes. Documents are stored locally on your device and available without internet. Cloud sync keeps everything updated when you're back online.

items.q: Will I get reminders before documents expire?
items.a: Yes. Folio sends gentle reminders before your passport, ID or any other document expires so you're never caught off guard.

items.q: Can I share documents with family?
items.a: Yes. Create shared folders to safely share travel plans, tickets or IDs with family and friends. Everyone sees the latest versions automatically.

items.q: What platforms is Folio available on?
items.a: Folio is available on iOS (iPhone and iPad) and Android devices. You can download it for free from the App Store or Google Play Store.
Yes. Folio is completely free with unlimited document storage, travel timeline, expiry alerts and all core features.

items.q: How does the travel timeline work?
items.a: The travel timeline automatically arranges your flights, hotel bookings, train tickets, and events in chronological order. It shows your complete itinerary for each trip, highlights upcoming departures, and keeps a history of past travels. No manual entry required.

items.q: Does Folio work with Apple Wallet passes?
items.a: Yes. You can import .pkpass files from Apple Wallet directly into Folio. Unlike Apple Wallet, Folio extracts and organizes the data, adds it to your travel timeline, and keeps everything searchable.

items.q: What happens if I lose my phone?
items.a: If you have a Folio account, your encrypted documents are backed up and can be restored on a new device. Just sign in and everything will be there.

passkeys.title: Secure access with Passkeys
passkeys.description: Passkeys keep your documents encrypted and accessible only to you. Your data stays on your device, protected by your biometric credentials, and even Folio cannot unlock your files.

privateByDesign.title: Private by design
privateByDesign.description: Every document is encrypted on your device and can be opened only with your Face ID, Touch ID or device passcode. We do not store passwords and cannot access your information.

simpleToUse.title: Simple to use
simpleToUse.description: Sign in instantly with your device biometrics. No passwords to create, remember or reset. Your access is always fast and effortless.

worksEverywhere.title: Works everywhere
worksEverywhere.description: Use your passkey across iPhone, Android and modern browsers. Your secure access follows you on any device.

reviews.title: What our users say
reviews.description: Real reviews from people who use Folio to organize their documents and travel.

items.name: Maria S.
items.text: Finally an app that keeps all my travel documents organized. I used to have screenshots scattered everywhere, now everything is in one place with automatic reminders before expiry.

items.name: James T.
items.text: The email forwarding feature is a game changer. I just forward my booking confirmations and they appear perfectly formatted in the app. Makes travel so much easier.

items.name: Sophie L.
items.text: Love how it extracts all the important details from my documents automatically. The shared folders feature is perfect for family trips. Highly recommend!
